parameters: Caught the enemy off-guard!
You were caught off-guard!
Welcome to the battle tutorial.
All battlers have basic stats - knowing the function of these is key to winning and preparing for encounters.
Battlers need \m[hp] to keep on fighting, and \m[sp] to use Skills.
Your power is influenced by \m[atk] and \m[mat].\| These strongly influence \m[phy] and \m[mag] attacks, respectively.
Meanwhile, \m[def] and \m[mdf] reduce the power of incoming \m[phy] and \m[mag] attacks.
Finally, \m[agi] dictates the turn order, with higher \m[agi] battlers going first.
Let's use a Basic attack to deal damage to this Drone.
Good!
Basic attacks are \m[phy] by default.\|
This means the damage they deal is strongly influenced by your
\m[atk], weakly influenced by your \m[mat] and reduced by the target's \m[def].
Now let's look at a \m[mag] attack. Go to your Skills tab and target the Drone using \is[4].
Good!
\m[mag] attacks are strongly influenced by your \m[mat], weakly influenced by your \m[atk] and reduced by the target's \m[mdf].
You took some damage there. Let’s try and recover some \m[hp] using a support Skill.
Go to the Skills tab and use Yurasa's Skill \is[45] on Elovia.
Excellent!
You may have noticed that \is[45] is not listed as \m[phy] \fior\fi \m[mag].
This means its power is equally influenced by \m[atk] and \m[mat].
Not sure what an enemy just did?
Use the item \ii[171] to gain detailed information about their stats, Skills and passives.
Go to the Items tab and use an \ii[171] on that Drone now.
\ii[171] x1 Obtained.
Well done!
Using an \ii[171] does not end your turn, so you don't have to worry about giving up offense or defence.
Items and Skills that have these \c[17]instant\c[0] properties will have a white lightning bolt over their icon (\i[30]),
or will state so in their description.
Now let’s try being on the defensive.
Use \is[2] to reduce Yurasa's damage taken by 50% for this turn.
Well done!
\is[2] has an inherent boost to \m[agi].\| This means a character using \is[2] will go first, no matter what.
It can also protect from certain status effects.\.\. Using an \ii[171] can help you figure out which Skills can be countered by \is[2]ing.
Now try finishing off these enemies on your own.
GabText \c[11]False life has no dominion here.
ShowGab
WaitForGab
GabText A Sentinel appears from the shadows to aid the Devourer...
ShowGab
GabText \c[11]Remnants of the old world. Leave them to wither away.
ShowGab
WaitForGab
GabText They're still activating... use this chance!
ShowGab
Would you like to go over the basics of battling?
Yes
No
Yes
Use the arrow keys & [SPACEBAR], or mouse & click to navigate the menus and select targets.

Various Skills and items can be used to aid you in battle alongside your basic attack, and you'll expand your arsenal as you progress.\! You can swap between Skills you've learnt any time outside of battle.
Items can be used outside of battle, whereas Skills cannot.
If offensive options don't seem favourable, you can Guard to reduce incoming damage by 50% for the turn.
The basic stats of actors in battle are as follows:

\i[10] HP / Health Points: When reduced to 0, the battler is knocked out.
\i[11] SP / Skill Points: Used for casting skills.

\i[26] ATK / Attack: Influences strength of Basic Attacks and (to a lesser degree) Skills.
\i[25] S.ATK / Skill Attack: Only influences strength of Skills.

\i[27] DEF / Defence: Reduces damage from Basic Attacks.
\i[28] S.DEF / Skill Defence: Reduces damage from Skills.
\i[29] AGI / Agility: Actors with higher AGI take actions before those with lower AGI.

Certain Skills will have inherent boosts to their AGI, meaning they are more likely to be pushed to the front of the turn order.\.\. Guarding, for example, will always be pushed before all other actions.
That concludes the basic tutorial.
No
